## Chemical Structure Example

Here is an example of a chemical structure:

```{=latex}
\begin{tikzpicture}
  % Draw a rectangle
  \draw (0,0) rectangle (3,2);

  % Draw a line from the bottom-left corner to the top-right corner
  \draw (0,0) -- (3,2);

  % Draw a circle in the center
  \draw (1.5,1) circle (0.5);

  % Add some text
  \node at (1.5,1) {Center};

  % Draw an arrow
  \draw[->] (3,0) -- (4,1);
  \node[right] at (4,1) {An arrow};

  % Draw a filled circle (dot)
  \filldraw (0,2) circle (0.1);

    % A more complex example with styles and options
    \draw[thick, red, fill=yellow, fill opacity=0.5] (0,3) rectangle (2,4);
    \draw[blue, dashed] (0,3) -- (2,4);

    % Using coordinates for more complex shapes
    \coordinate (A) at (5,0);
    \coordinate (B) at (6,2);
    \coordinate (C) at (7,0);
    \draw (A) -- (B) -- (C) -- cycle; % Draws a triangle

    % Adding a grid for easier positioning
    \draw[gray, very thin] (0,0) grid (7,4);

\end{tikzpicture}
